scenario: Simulates a real human browsing behavior with deliberate delays and natural navigation patterns (e.g., exploring multiple pages with variable time gaps)

reasoning: Real humans exhibit unpredictable delays (e.g., 5–30s) between actions, often pausing to think or scroll. Natural navigation follows logical paths (e.g., search → related content). Mouse/keyboard interactions are slower than automated bots, and users may revisit pages with variable timing. This mimics organic user behavior rather than scripted automation.
